availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
To the Sheriff of Grant County

You are commanded to summon John Neal & John W Marquiss to appear in the Grant Circuit Court on the first day of its May term to show cause why Judgment should not be rendered against them for Eight hundred Dollars on account of the forfeiture of the bail Bond executed by them for the appearance of the said John Neal in said Court, to answer the Charge of Burglary & Larceny committed by the said John Neal and have there and then this writ with due return how you have executed it. Given under my hand as Clerk of said Court, this 17th day of December 1862.
N H Jeffers, C, G, C, C
Upon the foregoing fifre ^summons^ is the following return Executed January 1st 1863 by handing John W Marquiss a copy hereof

J. T. McGinnis D S
for S Lucas S, G, C

The Deft John Neal not found in Grant County May 18" 1863
John Marksberg S, G, C
A Copy att N H Jeffers C. G. C. C
By Thos A Franklin D, C
